remarks: The polynomial remainder theorem, or little Bézout's theorem (by contrast to the regular Bézout's theorem ~ bezout ).  If a polynomial ` F ` is divided by the linear factor ` x - A ` , the remainder is equal to ` F ( A ) ` , the evaluation of the polynomial at ` A ` (interpreted as a constant polynomial).  This is part of Metamath 100 proof #89.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jul-2014.)
statement:
plyrem.1 $e |- G = ( Xp oF - ( CC X. { A } ) ) $.
plyrem.2 $e |- R = ( F oF - ( G oF x. ( F quot G ) ) ) $.
plyrem $p |- ( ( F e. ( Poly ` S ) /\ A e. CC ) -> R = ( CC X. { ( F ` A ) } ) ) $.
